channel.title: [PI] Click object to teleport WHEN standing in certain spot!

item.title: [PI] Click object to teleport WHEN standing in certain spot!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:3, topic:539856”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658705.msg4405737#msg4405737 date=1391926170]
This is the object action 1 button (click). In the packet processing just add a check like so:

switch(objId) { case OBJECT_ID: if (player.getPosition.equals(new Position(123, 123)) { player.teleport(new_x, new_y); } break; }
[/quote]
ti’s Pi.

The example you provided should work fine asking as you replace the = with ==.[/quote]Doesn’t mean the protocol magically changes, nor does the logic. It’s called pseudo-code.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Click object to teleport WHEN standing in certain spot!

item.title: [PI] Click object to teleport WHEN standing in certain spot!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

I want to make it so if a player is standing on

x pos = 0123 y pos = 0123
they can teleport by clicking on the object, but if they arent standing in the correct spot they won’t be teleported.

For example:

case 154:
if (c.absX = 2484 && c.absY = 2437){
c.getPA().startTeleport2(2484, 3430, 0);
c.getPA().addSkillXP(500, 16);
}
break;

Something like that but actually working.

Rep++

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Click object to teleport WHEN standing in certain spot!
